newsitem.title: SWITZERLAND: UBS maintains Winterthur as hold.
newsitem.headline: UBS maintains Winterthur as hold.

text.p: UBS equity analysts said they were maintaining their "hold" recommendation on Swiss insurer Winterthur, and also said they had raised earnings estimates.
The evaluation followed Winterthur's presentation of its 1996 results on May 14, and a meeting later with Winterthur chairman Peter Spaelti.
"Given the higher 1996 basis we are revising up our 1997 and 1998 earnings estimates," UBS analysts said.
"After recent share gains in past months, the shares are relatively highly valued; we are keeping our 'hold' recommendation," UBS said.

UBS's newly revised earnings estimates call for a consolidated profit of 600 million Swiss francs in 1997 versus the reported earnings of 507 million for 1996. UBS forecast 1998 consolidated profit at 680 million.
